messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think you re doing a fine job communicating here, Kim. You got your point across just fine. :o) Life is good. ~Mary The miracle is not to walk on water.
messages.messageBody:
>>I for one admire the way she speaks to this group (poor
>communicator here) and the way everyone has responded to her. >>

I think you're doing a fine job communicating here, Kim. You got your point
across just fine. :o)

Life is good.
~Mary

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the green
earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly alive."

~ Thich Nhat Hanh

messages.subject: RESPECTFULLY asking that the respectful talking thread be dropped
messages.msgSnippet: Yuki doesn t need to be spoken of as though she isn t here. Don t make people the topic of conversation. Talk about unschooling. Joyce Unschooling-dotcom
messages.messageBody:
Yuki doesn't need to be spoken of as though she isn't here.

Don't make people the topic of conversation. Talk about unschooling.

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.subject: Re: respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe its that Yoki has come here asking about unschooling instead of being defensive. I for one admire the way she speaks to this group (poor communicator
messages.messageBody:
Maybe its that Yoki has come here asking about unschooling instead of being
defensive. I for one admire the way she speaks to this group (poor
communicator here) and the way everyone has responded to her. Maybe
observations about her receiving different treatment than say you or I should
be kept to ourselves so that we don't make Yoki feel bad. Maybe we received
different treatment because we handled the way we spoke to this group poorly,
atleast I know I did. Thanks Yoki for being here, I'm learning a lot from
you! (and everyone else)
~Kim
<< PLEASE forgive me for bringing this up again. But I just HAVE to say it.
Yoki
(hi Yoki) has come to this list saying that she schools at home. No one has
jumped on her, told her to just do it, been short or impatient with her, >>

messages.subject: respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/9/03 3:44:22 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/9/03 3:44:22 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Just to point out an observation that I had; that maybe she wasn't being
defensive BECAUSE she was being treated respectfully. >>

But that implies that newcomers are all treated DIFFERENTLY!! They aren't.
Yoki got the same comments, questions and information anyone else gets.
REALLY.
She happens to be very open to learning, considering and asking more
questions.
That's the ONLY difference.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/9/03 1:07:37 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/9/03 1:07:37 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< But Yoki has been asking questions, NOT being defensive and telling us why
she should keep on schooling!!!
Why are you bringing this up again?
We don't need the little moral "lesson" you're trying to impart. Really. >>

I read it and thought the writer was being complimentary to the list, not
critical.
I don't know who wrote it--didn't notice, but I saw it as "SEE? This list
CAN work right!"

I didn't see it as a moral lesson. One of us read wrong. Could've been me.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: ... why ... Actually, the first responses to her questions were much the same as first responses to anyone s questions here.  It s usually the defensive
messages.messageBody:
>
> << But Yoki has been asking questions, NOT being defensive and telling us
why
> she should keep on schooling!!! >>
>
> Exactly!
>
> << Why are you bringing this up again? >>
>
> Just to point out an observation that I had; that maybe she wasn't being
> defensive BECAUSE she was being treated respectfully.

Actually, the first responses to her questions were much the same as first
responses to anyone's questions here. It's usually the defensive response
to the answers that gets the unpleasantness going, and Yoki didn't do that.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] respectful talking
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/9/03 7:07:36 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/9/03 7:07:36 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< But Yoki has been asking questions, NOT being defensive and telling us why
she should keep on schooling!!! >>

Exactly!

<< Why are you bringing this up again? >>

Just to point out an observation that I had; that maybe she wasn't being
defensive BECAUSE she was being treated respectfully.

<< We don't need the little moral "lesson" you're trying to impart. Really. >>

Wasn't implying (certainly didn't say it) that you do. Just making a timely
observation I had for anyone wanting to have some food for thought on the
heal of that loooong conversation. It's been made clear that anyone not
liking what's being said or the style of it, should just use the delete. So I
made my observation, and figured people could just delete it if they so
desired. Lara...........

messages.subject: respectful talking

Yoki

Ren
